alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 18 at 10:21PM EDT until April 19 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Ulster, Western Greene, Schoharie and Western Albany Counties. * WHEN...Until noon EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The heavy wet snow may bring down some tree limbs and cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may reach an inch per hour overnight. Accumulations will vary by elevation, with lower elevations such as the Schoharie Valley getting closer to 5 inches, and higher elevations above 2000 feet getting closer to 9 inches. There could be a light glaze of freezing rain late tonight into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Ulster
